ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip1
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: Hello! This is the learning tips. You can skip them, but I recommend you to read it if you are playing in the first time. There is a lot of mechanics and some of them quite complicated.

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip2
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: It is your people. By clicking on this icon, you can find all of their needs and consumptions. Right now, they need just some food, but after some researching, needs rise.

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip3
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: Number of people also displayed on this panel

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip4
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: Higher you can find the current date and the game speed.

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip5
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: This is the time managament menu. Here, you can decrease, increase the game speed or pause/unpause it.

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip6
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: Here is your free workers that can be assigned to any job.

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip7
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: Right now all the people collecting wild vegetables. Let's have a look on the structure closer

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip8
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: This is the number of workers assigned on this job

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip9
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: This is the current stock quantity and warehouse size.

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip10
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: This is the productivity of the current items: if it is positive, amount is rising, if it is negative, amount is decreasing. Based on the productivity, the arrow colors are changing: If source materials are rising, arrows are green. if source materials are going down, arrows are red. If source materials are constant or not used, arrows are white. You can find this information on the color legend

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip11
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: The button "minus" used to set a person free of this job.

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip12
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: The button "plus" used to set a person on this job. Let's produce some clean vegetables

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip13
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: This icon mean the researching. The stock here is how many items need/used.

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip14
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: After the whole bar fills, the research button avaliable. It unlocks new items and researchs

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip15
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: Hunting is a tricky thing. Right now, you can't choose who gets caught. Many animals are stronger than bare humans. Many animals are faster than bare humans. You definitely need something to be successful on the hunt.

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip16
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: It is your tool. Tools are using for increasing the speed of production or decreasing the consumtion of source materials.

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip17
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: If a worker get a tool, he/she don't return it and holds on his working place.

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip18
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: Tools can be damaged. Once a tool damaged, it returns to the production place, in the damaged stack. If the stack is full, damaged tools can be lost. If the damaged stack has some damaged tools, it repears before producing something new and much faster.

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip19
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: Also, tools can be destroyed. If it happens, the tool disappear.

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip20
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: A wicker backet is using as a light storage also. If you have enough light storage space, it could be used for increasing the production warehouse size. It also striks your backet's stock size

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip21
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: If you upgrade the warehouse size, the current amount of light or heavy items storage locks and cannot be used in any other way.

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip22
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: It is your the first house. Houses are using for living some people and have squadre for some decorative items. Your people cannot afford statues and pictures if they have no houses As tools, houses can be damaged and destroyed. Keep an eye on them!

ns1:repetative.ns1:name: tip23
ns1:repetative.ns1:description: if you don't need some houses, you can destroy them. But you cannot destroy houses while someone is living in it.
